translated: It has been demonstrated that it is just as it is.

original: dbang po med pa skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin te /üîΩ'di ltar snying gi mtshan nyid kyi lus nyid rgyu las sam /
analyzed: dbang po med pa skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin te / 'di ltar snying gi mtshan nyid kyi lus nyid rgyu las sam /
translated: But if you say that this reason, the characteristic of being devoid of a cause, is not unestablished, then the body with faculties or the body without faculties, characterized by the tips of the hair and nails, is the basis of mental consciousness.

original: gzhan las skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the body characterized by the heart itself arises from a cause or from another.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: lus ni rnam pa gnyis po dbang po dang bcas pa dang / dbang po med pa so so 'am gzhan du rgyu yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus ni rnam pa gnyis po dbang po dang bcas pa dang / dbang po med pa so so 'am gzhan du rgyu yin par 'gyur la /
translated: The body is the cause either separately or together with the sense faculties.

original: re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not together with the sense faculties.

original: de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because it would be apprehended like the mind.

original: dbang po bcas la yid shes min //
analyzed: dbang po bcas la yid shes min //
translated: The mental consciousness is not in the sense faculties together with the sense faculties.

original: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the capacity to generate consciousness is different.

original: kun las kyang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun las kyang ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from all of them.

original: sems med nyid phyir gzhan las min //
analyzed: sems med nyid phyir gzhan las min //
translated: Because it is mindless, it is not from another.

original: rgyu gcig phyir na lhan cig gnas //
analyzed: rgyu gcig phyir na lhan cig gnas //
translated: It coexists because of a single cause.

original: dbang bzhin gzugs da @56b ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang bzhin gzugs da @56b ro bzhin no //
translated: Like the sense faculties, like form.

original: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It is from the object.

original: re zhig so sor dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig so sor dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus rgyu ma yin no //
translated: First, the body together with the sense faculties is not the cause.

original: dbang po nus pa dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po nus pa dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Because it operates together with the capacity of the sense faculties, it is together with the sense faculties.

original: dbang po rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The nature of the sense faculties.

original: nus pa ni nus pa can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni nus pa can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity is not different from the one with capacity.

original: des na so so ba'i dbang po dag nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na so so ba'i dbang po dag nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness arises from the individual sense faculties.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: dbang por bcas la yid shes min //
analyzed: dbang por bcas la yid shes min //
translated: The mental consciousness does not arise from the sense faculties.

original: dbang po dag las so sor 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dag las so sor 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from the individual sense faculties,

original: de blo bzhin du dbang po'i blo bzhin du yul so sor 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de blo bzhin du dbang po'i blo bzhin du yul so sor 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then apprehend individual objects like the sense consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba yod na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba yod na /
translated: If it were to follow the sense faculties,

original: nges par dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would definitely follow the sense faculties.

original: yid gzhan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: yid gzhan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness would have a different nature from the sense consciousnesses.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: de'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin ma yin ba 'byung na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin ma yin ba 'byung na /
translated: then a result that is not of the nature of its cause would arise.

original: de'i rang bzhin de gang las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de gang las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: From what would a result that is of the nature of its cause arise?

original: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would be causeless.

original: gal te rgyu gcig yin yang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gcig yin yang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that even though a cause is one, a result that is and is not of its nature arises?

original: dper na me du ba dang thal ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me du ba dang thal ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, fire is by nature the producer of smoke and ash.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: But the collections are not different,

original: gzugs kyi tshogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed la gzugs dang bral ba ni yid kyi rnam shes skyed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed la gzugs dang bral ba ni yid kyi rnam shes skyed do //
translated: because the eye, which is present in the collection of form, produces visual consciousness, but not the mental consciousness, which is absent in the collection of form.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa yang brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa yang brjod do zhe na /
translated: The same is true of the ear, etc.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩdbang po'i bya ba la brten nas //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / dbang po'i bya ba la brten nas //
translated: That is not so,

original: 'byung ba dbang po'i las skye 'dod //
analyzed: 'byung ba dbang po'i las skye 'dod //
translated: because the elements are held to arise from the activity of the sense faculties.üîΩThe activity of the sense faculties is not in the mental consciousness,

original: bya de de la med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bya de de la med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is not in the sense faculties,

original: ji ltar dbang po las 'byung 'gyur //üîΩde blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po las 'byung 'gyur // de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
translated: like the activity of the eye, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows:

original: dbang po'i blo ni de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas don 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas don 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The sense faculties are said to be the cause of the mental consciousness because the mental consciousness apprehends objects in accordance with the activity of the sense faculties.

original: gal te yid kyi blo yang de yin na yang de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi blo yang de yin na yang de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: If the mental consciousness is also the cause of the mental consciousness, then the mental consciousness would apprehend objects in accordance with the activity of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i blo bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i blo bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be just like the cognition of that person.

original: gzhan du ji lta de ltar bsnyad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ji lta de ltar bsnyad par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be explained?

original: de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa yang dmigs pa med la de las skyes pa nyid du yang rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams so //
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa yang dmigs pa med la de las skyes pa nyid du yang rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams so //
translated: And it is also seen that the mental cognition does not have an object, and it is understood that it arises from that.

original: dbang po las ni don nye bar med par yang mdun na gnas pa'i don nges par @57a * //
analyzed: dbang po las ni don nye bar med par yang mdun na gnas pa'i don nges par @57a * //
translated: Even when the object is not present, the mental cognition arises with the aspect of the object that is in front of it.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam pa can dang / rab rib kyis nyams pa las skra shad kyi tshogs mthong ba'i rnam pa lta bu ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam pa can dang / rab rib kyis nyams pa las skra shad kyi tshogs mthong ba'i rnam pa lta bu ni /
translated: And like the cognition of a person with cataracts who sees a mass of hair,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig btsums kyang skye ba ni yin na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig btsums kyang skye ba ni yin na /
translated: the mental cognition arises even with the eyes closed.

original: ji ltar de las dbang pa'i byed pa yod /
analyzed: ji ltar de las dbang pa'i byed pa yod /
translated: How can the activity of the sense faculty exist in that?

original: gang rnam par 'gyur yang gang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa yin /
analyzed: gang rnam par 'gyur yang gang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa yin /
translated: And how can that which changes but does not change be born from the sense faculty?üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: de la / de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de la / de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because it is apprehended just like the cognition,

original: zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if that changes, consciousness changes.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: Apprehending is consciousness itself.

original: ci ste de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: But if it does not change because that changes,

original: de lta na de las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not produced from that.

original: kun las kyang ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun las kyang ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The same reply applies to the question, ‚ÄúNor is it from all.‚Äù

original: lan gzhan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: lan gzhan bshad pa ni /
translated: Another reply is:

original: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference in the capacity to produce consciousness,

original: shes pa skyed pa la nus pa tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa la nus pa tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: there is a difference in the capacity to produce consciousness.

original: so sor gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du mthong gi / phan tshun ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid du mthong gi / phan tshun ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is seen that each is independent of the other, but they are not mutually dependent.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig med kyang tshogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig med kyang tshogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: If that were not so, then even if one were absent, the collection would not exist.

original: sa la sogs pa ma tshang bas myu gu bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ma tshang bas myu gu bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Like a sprout, it would not occur if the earth, etc., were incomplete.

original: mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ma tshang ba la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yang yin no //
translated: But even when the eye, etc., are incomplete, mental consciousness arises.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi tshogs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi tshogs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not related to the collection of mental factors.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs snga ma sdud pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs snga ma sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the previous reason.

original: sems nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan dbang po med pa las kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan dbang po med pa las kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not seen from the absence of a sense faculty, because there is no mind.

original: gal te sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: gal te sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause there is no mind‚Äù?

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it means ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of a sense consciousness,‚Äù

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin na ji ltar 'dir gtan tshigs yin /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin na ji ltar 'dir gtan tshigs yin /
translated: then that is precisely what is to be proven, so how can it be a reason here?

original: gal te de las dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung du zad mod /
analyzed: gal te de las dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung du zad mod /
translated: If it means ‚Äúbecause a sense consciousness does not arise from it,‚Äù

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa go ci'i phyir mi 'byung /üîΩgal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa go ci'i phyir mi 'byung / gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir sems med pa nyid yin na /
translated: then why does a mental consciousness not arise from it?üîΩIf it means ‚Äúbecause there is no mental consciousness,‚Äù then that is precisely what is to be proven.

original: de nyid dpyod pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid dpyod pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that one part of the meaning of the thesis is the reason,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: gang tshe skra dang sen mo sogs //
analyzed: gang tshe skra dang sen mo sogs //
translated: When there is no hair, nails, and so on,

original: tshor byed nyid du ma mthong ba //
analyzed: tshor byed nyid du ma mthong ba //
translated: But when it is not seen as the experiencer,

original: de tshe de las yid kyis shes //
analyzed: de tshe de las yid kyis shes //
translated: then it is known by the mind as different from that.

original: skye bo zhes ni ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: skye bo zhes ni ji ltar rtogs //
translated: How can it be conceived as a person?

original: ji ltar reg pa la sogs pa dag / tshor bar byed cing ci'i rnam par shes @57b pa'i sgo nas dmigs par byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar reg pa la sogs pa dag / tshor bar byed cing ci'i rnam par shes @57b pa'i sgo nas dmigs par byed pa /
translated: Just as contact, etc. are the experiencers of feeling, and the eye, etc. are the experiencers of perception,

original: de bzhin du skra dang sen mo la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas tshor bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skra dang sen mo la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas tshor bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, hair, nails, etc. are not the experiencers of feeling by means of the mental consciousness.

original: de dang 'brel pa nyid yin na de med par yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa nyid yin na de med par yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If they were related to it, the mental consciousness would not occur without them,

original: de nyams pas nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyams pas nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and if they were impaired, it would be impaired.

original: gal te lus rten ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar lhan cig gnas she na /
analyzed: gal te lus rten ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar lhan cig gnas she na /
translated: If the body is not their support, how can they exist simultaneously?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: lhan cig gnas par nges par byed pa'i las kyi ming can gyi rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir nus pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin dang gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas par nges par byed pa'i las kyi ming can gyi rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir nus pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin dang gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
translated: Because the cause, which is called the action of determining simultaneous existence, is not different, they exist with that capacity, like the senses, form, and taste.

original: dper na dbang po rnams dang / gzugs dang ro dag phan tshun rten ma yin yang dus cung zad lhan cig gnas par nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po rnams dang / gzugs dang ro dag phan tshun rten ma yin yang dus cung zad lhan cig gnas par nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sense faculties and visible form, etc., and taste and taste-consciousness, etc., are not mutually dependent, but they are certainly simultaneous for a short period of time.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin no //üîΩgal te de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa'i rgyu ma yin no // gal te de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The state of being a support and something supported is not a cause of simultaneity.

original: mig la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If it were, then the eye, etc., would be the support of eye-consciousness, etc.,üîΩbecause they change when the body changes.

original: bad kan dang dug la sogs pas lus 'gyur na yid blong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bad kan dang dug la sogs pas lus 'gyur na yid blong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If the body changes due to phlegm, poison, etc., then the mind would change, because it would have the characteristics of depression, etc.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: don de gzung bar bya ba'i sgo nas 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: don de gzung bar bya ba'i sgo nas 'gyur ba yin /
translated: The body changes because it is affected by the object.

original: de goms pas gdung ba mi bzod pa de yid la gnod pas na /
analyzed: de goms pas gdung ba mi bzod pa de yid la gnod pas na /
translated: When the body is affected by the object, the mind is affected by the body, because the mind is not able to endure the pain.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind changes because it is affected by the body.

original: mtshon gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa yid kyis dmigs pas yid gdung bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshon gyis brdegs pa la sogs pa yid kyis dmigs pas yid gdung bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind is affected by the body when it is affected by the object, because the mind is pained by the mental perception of being struck by a weapon, etc.

original: rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as a support.

original: dmigs pas ni phyi rol las rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin na de rten gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pas ni phyi rol las rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin na de rten gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: If the mind is transformed by the object, then it is not the support of the object,

original: de med kyang sgro btags pa tsam gyis gdung ba skyed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang sgro btags pa tsam gyis gdung ba skyed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is generated by mere imputation, even when the object does not exist.

original: de phyir yid kyi sgro btags pas //
analyzed: de phyir yid kyi sgro btags pas //
translated: Therefore, the mind is imputed by the mental consciousness.

original: phyi dang nang gi rnam pa yod //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rnam pa yod //
translated: It has the aspect of external and internal.

original: de yi 'gyur ba'i yid kyis ni //
analyzed: de yi 'gyur ba'i yid kyis ni //
translated: The mind that is transformed by that

original: rnam par 'gyur ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: is transformed into that.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dag ni gcig nyid ma yin te /üîΩdes na lus de'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dag ni gcig nyid ma yin te / des na lus de'i rten ma yin no //
translated: The support and the object are not the same.üîΩTherefore, the body is not the support of the mind.

original: des na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni lus la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni lus la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the afflicted mind is not supported by the body.

original: de'i rten gang yin pa de ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rten gang yin pa de ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The support of the afflicted mind will be explained later.

original: snga phyi sgro btags pa tsam dmigs par zad kyi /
analyzed: snga phyi sgro btags pa tsam dmigs par zad kyi /
translated: The mind is imputed as prior and subsequent, and it is merely the object of imputation.

original: gzhan ni med pa'i phyir yid ni dmigs pa med cing rten med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni med pa'i phyir yid ni dmigs pa med cing rten med pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no other, the mind is without an object and without a support.

original: gzhan yang / phan 'dogs byed pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phan 'dogs byed pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Moreover,

original: de yi zlog byed rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: de yi zlog byed rgyu ma yin //
translated: The cause of the reversal of that is not the cause of the effect.

analyzed: gal te dge legs su mi 'gyur na ni rnam par 'gyur ba 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not good fortune, this transformation would not occur.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi tha snyad yin no //
translated: This transformation is produced by that‚Äîthis is the convention of the entire world.

original: gzhan du yang 'di tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'di tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: Even in other cases, this is the mere effect.

original: 'byung ba ci ltar rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba ci ltar rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How can the primary elements be a cause?

original: de la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not mistaken with regard to their effect.

original: gal te gang phan 'dogs pa de rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang phan 'dogs pa de rgyu yin na /
translated: If that which benefits is a cause,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can the primary elements benefit what is not yet existent?

original: 'o na 'das pa yang rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na 'das pa yang rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, the past also would not be a cause,

original: de yang med pas phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: de yang med pas phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // ma yin te /
translated: because it does not exist and therefore does not benefit.

original: de skye ba'i dus na ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de skye ba'i dus na ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because it exists at the time of the effect.

original: de skye ba'i dus de gang yin /
analyzed: de skye ba'i dus de gang yin /
translated: What is that time of the effect?

original: gal te 'bras bu las sngar ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las sngar ro zhe na /
translated: If it is prior to the effect,üîΩhow can it benefit what does not yet exist?

original: ji ltar med pa la phan 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir rgyu yin te med pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa la phan 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir rgyu yin te med pa byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: For that very reason it is a cause, because it makes what does not exist.

original: med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /üîΩde'i de ma thag tu de yod pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don ci yin / de'i de ma thag tu de yod pa'o zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of making what does not exist?üîΩIt exists immediately after that.

original: de ma thag pa de ni gnyi ga la ltos nas kyang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa de ni gnyi ga la ltos nas kyang mtshungs te /
translated: That which is immediate is the same for both.

original: ji ltar 'byung bar gyur pa la ltos nas yin pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos nas kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar gyur pa la ltos nas yin pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos nas kyang yin no //
translated: Just as it is in dependence on what has arisen, so it is in dependence on what will arise.

original: de ma thag pa nyid ni de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa nyid ni de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang ma yin te /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is not the reason for that.

original: chod pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chod pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even what is interrupted is a cause.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gnyid stug log pa sad pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gnyid stug log pa sad pa na //
translated: When one awakens from deep sleep,

original: rnam shes sngon gyi rim pa las //
analyzed: rnam shes sngon gyi rim pa las //
translated: consciousness arises in a sequence from the previous consciousness.

original: dus kyis bar du chod kyang ni //
analyzed: dus kyis bar du chod kyang ni //
translated: Even though it is interrupted by time,

original: skye bo zhes ni rnam par nges //
analyzed: skye bo zhes ni rnam par nges //
translated: it is ascertained by people.

original: de la lus ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de la lus ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the cause there,

original: de ni sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen to follow the previous formative forces.

original: lus de 'dra ba nyid na sngon gyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun par gzhan dang gzhan du skye pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @60a * //
analyzed: lus de 'dra ba nyid na sngon gyi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun par gzhan dang gzhan du skye pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @60a * //
translated: Because when the body is like that, it arises in another and another way in accordance with the previous consciousness.

original: dngos po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason for the nature of cause and effect is the conformity with the presence and absence of the effect.

original: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang yod pa yin no //
translated: and it is also present in what is to come.

original: gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That which follows after and turns back in accordance with something is the cause of that,

original: khyad par gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ni don med do //
translated: because another distinction is meaningless.

original: 'on te yang 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: But if this exists, that comes to be;üîΩfrom the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of the relation of cause and effect.

original: 'dir 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tsam zhig brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tsam zhig brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not just the mere following after and turning back that is stated,üîΩbecause it is said:

original: 'di ltar / bdun pa dang ni lnga pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdun pa dang ni lnga pa yis //
translated: By the seventh and the fifth,

original: snga ma'i dngos por bstan pa yin //
analyzed: snga ma'i dngos por bstan pa yin //
translated: the prior state is indicated.

original: phyi ma'i dngos po dang po yis //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dngos po dang po yis //
translated: By the first of the latter states,

original: de nas kyang ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de nas kyang ni bstan pa yin //
translated: then that is also indicated.

original: 'dir de rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa tsam zhig bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa tsam zhig bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the mere following after and turning back is not indicated,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyid du ston par gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyid du ston par gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is clear that the prior and subsequent states are indicated.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: de phyir bdun pa dang de las //
analyzed: de phyir bdun pa dang de las //
translated: Therefore, the seventh and that which is derived from it.üîΩüîΩ

original: skyes phyir zhes kyang brjod pa yin //
analyzed: skyes phyir zhes kyang brjod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is also said that the seventh and the fifth are the reason for the existence of the past and future.

original: bdun pa'am lnga pas snga ma'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa'am lnga pas snga ma'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The seventh and the fifth are not taught as the entity of the past and future,

original: rgyu mtshan tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: but only as the reason for their existence.

original: 'di 'di'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de nyid yod na /
analyzed: 'di 'di'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gang zhig yod pas gang 'byung ba de nyid yod na /
translated: The meaning is that this is the reason for the existence of the past and future.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: When something exists, that which arises due to it is said to be the reason for its existence.

original: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na zhes ci ltar bsnyad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na zhes ci ltar bsnyad par bya ste /
translated: If it is said that it will arise, how can it be said to exist?

original: de ni med pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not tenable to teach it in that way.

original: de bzhin du ma skyes pa la skyes pa yang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma skyes pa la skyes pa yang ngo zhe na /
translated: In the same way, it is said that the future exists because the past exists.

original: 'o na de yod na zhes bstan par bya ba 'das pa yang ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na de yod na zhes bstan par bya ba 'das pa yang ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: But if it exists, how can it be said to be the past?

original: zhig pa skyes pa yang ci ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhig pa skyes pa yang ci ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: And how can the arising of the past be said to exist?

original: 'di yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang 'byung ngo //
translated: This is also the case.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag las khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag las khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between something that does not exist prior to and something that does not exist after having existed?

original: yang na 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba gang gis dngos pos dngos po mtshon pa zhes bya ba 'dis bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba gang gis dngos pos dngos po mtshon pa zhes bya ba 'dis bdun pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the statement ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù indicates that an existent thing is the cause of an existent thing.

original: des na yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po tsam zhig mtshon pa yin gyi de'i tshe yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po tsam zhig mtshon pa yin gyi de'i tshe yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù indicates the mere fact of being a reason, but it does not indicate existence at that time.üîΩThe fact that something exists because something else exists

original: de yod pas yod par mtshon pa ni /üîΩ'byung ba yod pas kyang /
analyzed: de yod pas yod par mtshon pa ni / 'byung ba yod pas kyang /
translated: is also indicated by the word ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: yod pa mtshon pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa mtshon pa nyid de /
translated: The fact that something exists because something else exists is also indicated by the word ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: 'chi ltas ni 'chi bas byas so zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ltas ni 'chi bas byas so zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: The world uses the expression ‚Äúdeath is caused by dying.‚Äù

original: gal te 'chi bar mi 'gyur @60b na 'di lta bu'i 'chi ltas su mi 'gyur ro zhes so //üîΩskyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba kyang dus kyi rnam par dbye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'chi bar mi 'gyur @60b na 'di lta bu'i 'chi ltas su mi 'gyur ro zhes so // skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba kyang dus kyi rnam par dbye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If death did not exist, then the signs of death would not exist.üîΩThe word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù does not indicate a temporal distinction.

original: rnam par dbye bas ni dus kyi khyad par brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye bas ni dus kyi khyad par brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: A temporal distinction is not expressed by the word ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: byed pa po tsam zhig ston par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po tsam zhig ston par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is able to show the mere agent.

original: byed pa po nyid med pa la ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid med pa la ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can the non-existent be an agent?

original: ci ltar myu gu skye'o //
analyzed: ci ltar myu gu skye'o //
translated: As in the case of the sprout, which is said to arise,

original: dum par bya'o zhes byed pa dang las kyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: dum par bya'o zhes byed pa dang las kyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: and the threshing, which is said to be done.

original: blo la gnas pas byed pa po nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: blo la gnas pas byed pa po nyid do zhe na /
translated: But it is the agent because it is present in the cognition.

original: 'dir ni de bya rog gis ma zos so //
analyzed: 'dir ni de bya rog gis ma zos so //
translated: But here the crow did not eat it.

original: 'on te gang zhig gang dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can du dmigs pa de rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig gang dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can du dmigs pa de rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the object that is perceived as preceding is the cause,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: gang gi dang por dmigs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gi dang por dmigs 'gyur ba //
translated: If the first perception

original: gal te de de'i rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te de de'i rgyu yin na //
translated: is the cause of that,

original: gting du chud pa'i sa bon ni //
analyzed: gting du chud pa'i sa bon ni //
translated: then the seed that is submerged

original: myu gu sogs kyi rgyur mi 'gyur //
analyzed: myu gu sogs kyi rgyur mi 'gyur //
translated: would not be the cause of the sprout, etc.

original: 'on te de'i rigs can dang por mthong ba'i phyir de ltar brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rigs can dang por mthong ba'i phyir de ltar brjod na /
translated: But if it is said that way because the first perception of the same type is seen,

original: ma dmigs pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur ba gzhan dmigs pas gzhan dmigs par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur ba gzhan dmigs pas gzhan dmigs par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: how can the non-perceived be the cause? It would be the object of perception by another perception, but that is not so.

original: nye bar brtags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be mere imputation.

original: des na dmigs pa ni yod pa mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa ni yod pa mtshon pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is what exists.

original: de lta na yang don de nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang don de nyid do //
translated: But that is the same as the meaning.

original: 'di yod na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid la de yang mi 'khrul ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yod na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid la de yang mi 'khrul ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúIf this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù the existence of the reason is the object of the nonerroneous subject.

original: gang gi sngar dmigs pa zhes bya ba yin na ni sngar yod pa thams cad rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi sngar dmigs pa zhes bya ba yin na ni sngar yod pa thams cad rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were said that the object is what existed previously, then it would follow, absurdly, that everything that exists previously would be the cause.

original: mi 'khrul ba yul can yin na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba yul can yin na /
translated: If the object is the nonerroneous subject,

original: de nyid rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu yin no //
translated: then that is the cause.

original: 'on te mi 'khrul ba'i yul can du 'gyur ba na sngar yod pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'khrul ba'i yul can du 'gyur ba na sngar yod pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the object is what existed previously when it becomes the nonerroneous subject,

original: de yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: de yang gyi na ste /
translated: that is not right.

original: de yod yod pa nyid tsam gyis //
analyzed: de yod yod pa nyid tsam gyis //
translated: Because of the mere fact of its existence,

original: gal te 'bras nyid yin na //
analyzed: gal te 'bras nyid yin na //
translated: if it is the effect,

original: ci 'gal de tshe snga ma dang // phyi ma'i dngos po don ci yod //
analyzed: ci 'gal de tshe snga ma dang // phyi ma'i dngos po don ci yod //
translated: then what is the point of the previous and subsequent states?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gang du nye bar mkho ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gang du nye bar mkho ste /
translated: Where is the need for the previous and subsequent states?

original: nye bar mkho ba med pa la ni ltos ni /
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba med pa la ni ltos ni /
translated: If there is no need, then what is the point of the dependence?

original: 'byung ngo // 'on te /
analyzed: 'byung ngo // 'on te /
translated: But if it is maintained thatüîΩthe first is the cause,

original: dang po nyid ni 'gyur 'dod na //
analyzed: dang po nyid ni 'gyur 'dod na //
translated: then what is the point of the previous and subsequent states?

original: de don gnyer rnams len pa yin //
analyzed: de don gnyer rnams len pa yin //
translated: Those who seek the result can take up the cause.

original: phyi ma nyid ni rjes dpog gang //
analyzed: phyi ma nyid ni rjes dpog gang //
translated: The latter is inference.

original: de ni nus pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nus pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: It is possible because of the former.

original: rgyu snga ma ni 'bras bu don du gnyer bas blang bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu snga ma ni 'bras bu don du gnyer bas blang bar nus pa yin te /
translated: The former cause is able to take up the result for the sake of which it is sought.

original: des rgyu ni snga ma'i dngos por 'dod pa yin no //üîΩdper na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub pa'i phyir de'i sngar yod pa da ltar 'dir /
analyzed: des rgyu ni snga ma'i dngos por 'dod pa yin no // dper na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub pa'i phyir de'i sngar yod pa da ltar 'dir /
translated: Therefore, the former is asserted to be the state of the cause.üîΩFor example, in order to establish the future world, the present world exists prior to it and takes it up as its basis.

original: rten 'di len pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rten 'di len pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the former cause is able to take up the result for the sake of which it is sought.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /üîΩde la rgyu nyid kyang yod pa yin te /üîΩsngar yod pa nyid la rgyu nyid med pa @61a * //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de / de la rgyu nyid kyang yod pa yin te / sngar yod pa nyid la rgyu nyid med pa @61a * //
translated: That is not tenable.üîΩThe former cause is not nonexistent.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the state of existence of the former cause is nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba mi 'khrul pa la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid kyang yin no zhes brjod do //üîΩrgyu nyid yin na len pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu nyid la yang 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba mi 'khrul pa la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid kyang yin no zhes brjod do // rgyu nyid yin na len pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu nyid la yang 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, it is said that it is the result in dependence on the nonerroneous occurrence of the latter.üîΩIf it is the cause, that which is taken up is also the result.

original: len pa la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: len pa la khyad par ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between taking up the cause and taking up the result?

original: mi 'khrul pa tsam gyis blang bar bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa tsam gyis blang bar bya ba yin pas /
translated: But it is not necessary to accept that the future exists, since it is accepted that the effect is produced by the mere non-deception of the cause.

original: 'di tsam gyis ma chog pa ci yod /üîΩgang yang rgyu nus pa nyid las rjes su dpog ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ma chog pa ci yod / gang yang rgyu nus pa nyid las rjes su dpog ste /
translated: What more is needed?üîΩAnd it is not the case that the future is not inferred from the power of the cause,

original: de la 'bras bu nyid kyis ci zhig bya zhes brjod pa de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu nyid kyis ci zhig bya zhes brjod pa de yang ma yin te /
translated: for what purpose is there in positing an effect?

original: su zhig lag tu thob pa'i rdzas //üîΩrkang gis bgrod par byed pa'am //
analyzed: su zhig lag tu thob pa'i rdzas // rkang gis bgrod par byed pa'am //
translated: Who would wait for something to be obtained in the handüîΩto be traveled to on foot,

original: sen mo yis ni gcad bya ba //
analyzed: sen mo yis ni gcad bya ba //
translated: or to be cut with a fingernail?

original: sta res gcad par su zhig bzod //
analyzed: sta res gcad par su zhig bzod //
translated: Who would wait for something to be cut with an axe?

original: lag tu thob pa rkang gis bgrod par byed pa'am sen mos gcod pa ste res gcod pa la su zhig sdod /
analyzed: lag tu thob pa rkang gis bgrod par byed pa'am sen mos gcod pa ste res gcod pa la su zhig sdod /
translated: Who would wait for something to be obtained in the hand to be traveled to on foot, or to be cut with a fingernail or with an axe?

original: gtso bo'i 'bras bu nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gtso bo'i 'bras bu nyid kyis ni //
translated: If the effect of the principal

original: drang po'i tshul du go byed na //
analyzed: drang po'i tshul du go byed na //
translated: is understood in a straightforward way,üîΩthen it is pointless to understand

original: 'bad pas bsgrub bya rgyu nyid kyis //üîΩgo bar byed pa don med yin //
analyzed: 'bad pas bsgrub bya rgyu nyid kyis // go bar byed pa don med yin //
translated: the effect that is to be accomplished through effort.

original: de'i phyir mi 'khrul pas na ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'khrul pas na ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that the future exists because of non-deception.

original: lus las ni don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: lus las ni don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The future exists from the perspective of the object, but not from the perspective of the body.

original: mig la sogs pa ltar rten gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes re zhig bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltar rten gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes re zhig bshad pa yin no //
translated: but not as a support, like the eyes, etc.

original: da ni khas blangs nas brjod de /
analyzed: da ni khas blangs nas brjod de /
translated: Now, having accepted that, we say:

original: bum sogs la ni me sogs bzhin //
analyzed: bum sogs la ni me sogs bzhin //
translated: Like fire, etc. for a pot, etc.

original: gang zhig tshe na sems rgyun gyi //
analyzed: gang zhig tshe na sems rgyun gyi //
translated: When the mind-series

original: phan 'dogs byed pa'ang yin bla ste //
analyzed: phan 'dogs byed pa'ang yin bla ste //
translated: is helpful, it is a support.

original: de tsam gyis ni ldog pa min //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni ldog pa min //
translated: But that alone does not stop it.

original: res 'ga' rten nyid kyis lus phan 'dogs par byed pa yin yang de tsam gyis ni lus log na sems kyi rgyun log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' rten nyid kyis lus phan 'dogs par byed pa yin yang de tsam gyis ni lus log na sems kyi rgyun log pa ma yin te /
translated: Sometimes the body is helpful as a support, but that alone does not stop the mind-series when the body stops.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni /
translated: For, by the mere fact of being helpful,

original: phan gdags par bya ba'i zlog par byed pa ma yin te /üîΩme la sogs pas phan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni me la sogs pa log na nges par log pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba'i zlog par byed pa ma yin te / me la sogs pas phan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni me la sogs pa log na nges par log pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: the helped is not stopped.üîΩA pot, etc. helped by fire, etc. is not necessarily stopped when the fire, etc. stops.

original: gser la sogs pa'i zhu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par me las 'gyur ba yin na yang de log na ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i zhu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par me las 'gyur ba yin na yang de log na ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And even though the special characteristics of melting, etc. of gold, etc. arise from fire, etc., they are not stopped when that stops.

original: gal te zhu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de nyid ldog kyang gser nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gal te zhu ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de nyid ldog kyang gser nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: If the specific characteristics of the request, etc., were to cease, then gold would not be its nature.

original: gang zhig sems kyi rgyu yin pa de'i ltar na lus de'i gnas skabs su yod pa yin yang de ma tshang ba las ldog pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig sems kyi rgyu yin pa de'i ltar na lus de'i gnas skabs su yod pa yin yang de ma tshang ba las ldog pa ni /
translated: If the body were the cause of the mind, then even when the body exists in that state, the cessation of the mind due to the incompleteness of its causes would be contradictory.

original: lus 'ba' zhig rgyu yin pa la 'gal @61b par brjod do //
analyzed: lus 'ba' zhig rgyu yin pa la 'gal @61b par brjod do //
translated: It is said that the body alone is the cause.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa ni /üîΩlus ni gnas pa yin na sems //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa ni / lus ni gnas pa yin na sems //
translated: Moreover, it is said:üîΩIf the body were to endure,

original: ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the mind would not cease.

original: de yod yod dang dbang 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de yod yod dang dbang 'gyur phyir //

original: de las 'byung rngub de ma yin //üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa lus med pa'i gnas skabs su ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ldog tu chug na lus de lta bu nyid du gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de las 'byung rngub de ma yin // thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa lus med pa'i gnas skabs su ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ldog tu chug na lus de lta bu nyid du gnas pa'am /
translated: Inhalation and exhalation would not be from that.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ldog pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ldog pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If it were to cease, etc., it could cease in the absence of a body because there would be no cause. But it is not tenable that such a body would cease, either enduring or changing.

original: gnas skabs mtha' dag gi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs mtha' dag gi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow all states.

original: 'on te de ni 'byung ba rngub pa dag gi yang 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'byung ba rngub pa dag gi yang 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Or, is it the result of both inhalation and exhalation?

original: des na de ma tshang ba'i phyir ldog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de ma tshang ba'i phyir ldog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If so, then it ceases because of the incompleteness of its cause.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems nyid las yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems nyid las yin gyi /
translated: Inhalation and exhalation are due to the mind itself,

original: de las ni sems pa yin pa'i phyir lan ma yin no //
analyzed: de las ni sems pa yin pa'i phyir lan ma yin no //
translated: but the mind is not due to inhalation and exhalation.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de yod yod phyir te /
analyzed: de yod yod phyir te /
translated: Because it exists when they exist.

original: sems yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems yod na de dag yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems yod na yod pa'i phyir ro // sems yod na de dag yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mind exists when they exist.üîΩThe mind exists when inhalation and exhalation exist,

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no//
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no//
translated: but inhalation and exhalation do not exist when the mind exists.

original: dbang du 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Because it is dominant.

original: 'byung rngub dag las ni de ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dag las ni de ma yin no //

original: gal te 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyu yin na /
translated: If inhalation and exhalation are the cause of the mind,

original: de'i tshe de dag dbang nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag dbang nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

original: de dag ni sems kyi dbang du 'gyur bar dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems kyi dbang du 'gyur bar dmigs pa yang yin no //

original: gal te gzhan las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe de dag de nyid las skyes pas sems cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe de dag de nyid las skyes pas sems cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they arise from another, then since they arise from that, the mind would not be a cause at all.

original: gzhan la rag las pa ni gzhan gyis dbang bsgyur ba'i nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa ni gzhan gyis dbang bsgyur ba'i nus pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on another‚Äù does not mean that they are powerless,

original: sems ni rang gi rgyu la rag las pa de dag gi yongs su gcod par byed pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems ni rang gi rgyu la rag las pa de dag gi yongs su gcod par byed pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: because the mind is dependent on its own cause. It would be merely the cause of their determination.

original: 'on te de dag gi rgyu sems lhan cig byed pa can de dag skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi rgyu sems lhan cig byed pa can de dag skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /

original: 'o na sems kyang de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na sems kyang de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag las skyes pa ma yin no //

original: 'on te rtsa ba gzhan las skyes kyang sems kyi nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rtsa ba gzhan las skyes kyang sems kyi nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: But if it arises from another root, then it is the determiner of the mind.

original: dper na rje bos bran bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rje bos bran bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like a master and his servant.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bran ni gzhan las skye nyid du //
analyzed: bran ni gzhan las skye nyid du //
translated: Because it is seen that a servant arises from another.üîΩBut that is not the case for those.üîΩBecause it is seen that a servant arises from another,

original: mthong ba yin gyi de dag min //üîΩsems med par ni gzhan dag las //
analyzed: mthong ba yin gyi de dag min //üîΩsems med par ni gzhan dag las //
translated: but that is not the case for those.

original: de dag skye ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag skye ba yod ma yin //
translated: They do not arise from any other cause.

original: bran bzhin du 'byung rngub dag ni sems med par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: bran bzhin du 'byung rngub dag ni sems med par ma mthong ste /
translated: Inhaling and exhaling are not seen to be mindless, like a machine, because they are not like that.

original: des na de dag rgyu gzhan las ma yin par sems nyid rgyu @62a * //
analyzed: des na de dag rgyu gzhan las ma yin par sems nyid rgyu @62a * //
translated: Therefore, they are not from any other cause, but from the mind itself as their cause.

original: yin no // de'i phyir de dag las de ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir de dag las de ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not from that.

original: 'on te gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pas de'i rgyu sems ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pas de'i rgyu sems ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that since inhaling and exhaling exist in the state of sleep, etc., the mind is not their cause,

original: de'i rgyu can ni de med par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ni de med par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because that which has it as its cause does not occur when it is absent,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: lus kyi spyod pa ji snyed pa //
analyzed: lus kyi spyod pa ji snyed pa //
translated: As many bodily activities as there are,

original: de kun sems kyi 'dus byas yin //
analyzed: de kun sems kyi 'dus byas yin //
translated: all of them are conditioned by the mind.

original: gnyid log dbugs 'byung ring thung sogs //
analyzed: gnyid log dbugs 'byung ring thung sogs //
translated: The length of the breath in sleep, etc.,

original: de ni sngar gyi sems las yin //
analyzed: de ni sngar gyi sems las yin //
translated: is from the previous mind.

original: dbugs ring du 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mtha' dag ni sngon gyi sems kyi 'du byed rjes su 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: dbugs ring du 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mtha' dag ni sngon gyi sems kyi 'du byed rjes su 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: The entire transformation of long exhalation, etc., is consequent upon the previous mental formation.

original: 'di ltar dbugs byung dal goms pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs byung dal goms pas //
translated: Thus, through long practice of exhalation,

original: rmi lam du yang dal ba nyid //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang dal ba nyid //
translated: Even in dreams, there is no other life.

original: dbugs 'dren gzhan du gyur pa las //
analyzed: dbugs 'dren gzhan du gyur pa las //
translated: The in-breath and out-breath are transformed

original: gzhan nyid du ni 'gyur ba yin //üîΩrgyu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ston par byed pa ni /üîΩrlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ni 'gyur ba yin // rgyu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ston par byed pa ni / rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni //
translated: into something else, and so is the body.üîΩThe following verse shows that the in-breath and out-breath are not the cause of the body.üîΩFrom what cause do the in-breath and out-breath

original: 'bad rtsol med par gang las yin //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol med par gang las yin //
translated: arise without effort?

original: de dag phul byung 'grib pa las //
analyzed: de dag phul byung 'grib pa las //
translated: From the diminution of the excellent,

original: phul byung 'grib pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: phul byung 'grib pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: the excellent is obtained.

original: gal te sems 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rtsol ba med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rtsol ba med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the in-breath and out-breath were the effect of the mind, then the effort of the in-breath and out-breath would be without cause.

original: de lta na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de dag ni 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te de dag gi 'byin pa dang 'dren pa nyid sems la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni 'byin pa dang 'dren pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on te de dag gi 'byin pa dang 'dren pa nyid sems la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the in-breath and out-breath are by nature the cause of the body.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: But the in-breath and out-breath are dependent on the mind, not on their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las yin no //
translated: Their own nature is from another cause.

original: de'i phyir de las sems yin zhing de las 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las sems yin zhing de las 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, mind is from that, and it is from that that it is emitted and drawn in.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gal te shi la'ang rlung de ni //
analyzed: gal te shi la'ang rlung de ni //
translated: because if that wind exists even in a dead body,üîΩhow can the mind be stopped?

original: yod na sems pa ji ltar ldog / gal te de ni de yi rgyu //
analyzed: yod na sems pa ji ltar ldog / gal te de ni de yi rgyu //
translated: If it is not the cause of that,

original: min na lus rgyu yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: min na lus rgyu yin par 'gyur //
translated: the body would be the cause.

original: gal te gnas pa'i rlung sems pa'i rgyu ma yin na sems ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa'i rlung sems pa'i rgyu ma yin na sems ldog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the life-sustaining wind is not the cause of the mind, then the mind would be stopped.

original: 'on te rgyu yin na de lta na yang shi ba la yang gnas pa'i rlung yod pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de med pas sems ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir na ldog pa med par thal lo //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yin na de lta na yang shi ba la yang gnas pa'i rlung yod pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de med pas sems ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir na ldog pa med par thal lo //
translated: But if it is the cause, then even in a dead body the life-sustaining wind exists, and because inhalation and exhalation are by nature the result of that, the mind would not be stopped because it is absent.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis sems 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis sems 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The increase and decrease of inhalation and exhalation would also result in the increase and decrease of the mind,

original: de de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of that.

original: gdon mi za bar rgyu 'phel ba @62b dang 'grib pa na 'bras bu 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rgyu 'phel ba @62b dang 'grib pa na 'bras bu 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: Without doubt, when the cause increases or decreases, the effect increases or decreases.

original: gzhan du na de rgyu zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de rgyu zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be the cause.

original: de dag la yang thal bar mtshungs //
analyzed: de dag la yang thal bar mtshungs //
translated: The same consequence applies to them.

original: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin //
analyzed: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin //
translated: But it is not the same for the mind as cause.

original: gnas pa'i 'phen byed gzhan dag kyang //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'phen byed gzhan dag kyang //
translated: Other propulsions of the mind‚Äôs continuance

original: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
analyzed: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
translated: are accepted as causes.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyu yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyu yin du chug mod /
translated: Let us admit that inhalation and exhalation are the causes of the mind.

original: de lta na yang lus ni gnas pa nyid na sems ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang lus ni gnas pa nyid na sems ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, it follows that the body would not be without mind when it is in a state of continuance,

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag kyang mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag kyang mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inhalation and exhalation would not cease.

original: de dag kyang lus kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang lus kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: They are not without mind because they are the effects of the body.

original: de mi ldog na sems kyang mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi ldog na sems kyang mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not without mind, the mind would not cease.

original: 'di snyam du sems sems kyi rgyu yin pa la yang thal ba 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems sems kyi rgyu yin pa la yang thal ba 'di nyid do //
translated: If you think that the same consequence applies to the mind as the cause of the mind,

original: sems ni gnas pa nyid na sems //
analyzed: sems ni gnas pa nyid na sems //
translated: If the mind is in a state of abiding,

original: ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then the mind would be without cessation.

original: de yi snga ma 'dod na ni //
analyzed: de yi snga ma 'dod na ni //
translated: If you accept that,

original: snga ma'i sems ni ldog ma yin //
analyzed: snga ma'i sems ni ldog ma yin //
translated: then the previous mind would not cease.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin //
analyzed: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin //
translated: If the mind is the cause, it is not the same.

original: gnas pa'i 'phen byed gzhan dag kyang //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'phen byed gzhan dag kyang //
translated: Other projecting causes

original: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
analyzed: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
translated: are accepted as the cause.

original: lus de la sred pa dang bcas pa las kyi ming can gyi rgyu gzhan dag kyang 'dod pa yin no //üîΩsnga ma'i sems kyi rgyun yod pa tsam las /
analyzed: lus de la sred pa dang bcas pa las kyi ming can gyi rgyu gzhan dag kyang 'dod pa yin no // snga ma'i sems kyi rgyun yod pa tsam las /
translated: Other causes, which are called ‚Äúactions,‚Äù are accepted as the cause of that body, along with craving.

original: sems skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The mind does not arise merely from the continuum of the previous mind,

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed kyi bag chags kyi ming can gzhan yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed kyi bag chags kyi ming can gzhan yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ignorance and so on are posited as the nature of the mind, and other causes called ‚Äúlatent predispositions‚Äù are also posited as the cause.

original: de sems snga mas sad par byed pa na de 'am gzhan du sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de sems snga mas sad par byed pa na de 'am gzhan du sems skyed par byed de /
translated: When the previous mind activates the latent predispositions, it causes the mind to arise, either as itself or as something else,

original: bag chags kyi khyad par dang sad par byed pa na sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi khyad par dang sad par byed pa na sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent predispositions are various and are activated in various ways.

original: dper na gnyid dang 'brel ba tsam gyis ni rmi lam sna tshogs mthong ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
