original: gal te slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de lta na ni lus rgyu nyid du shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de lta na ni lus rgyu nyid du shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were to live again, then the body would be known as the cause.

original: sems kyi rgyu ni sems yin na //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ni sems yin na //
translated: The cause of the mind is the mind.

original: ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: It does not cease,

original: sems mi mthun pa med pa ni //
analyzed: sems mi mthun pa med pa ni //
translated: because the mind without an adversary

original: phyir yang 'ong bar mthong ba yin //
analyzed: phyir yang 'ong bar mthong ba yin //
translated: is seen to return again.

original: lus rgyu yin par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: lus rgyu yin par 'gyur na ni //
translated: If the body were the cause,

original: mi mthun ldog par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: mi mthun ldog par 'gyur ba na //
translated: it would cease through an adversary.

original: de 'dra ba yi lus de nyid //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yi lus de nyid //
translated: That very body is like that.üîΩ

original: ji ltar sems kyi rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi rgyu ma yin //
translated: How can that body be the cause of the mind?

original: lus rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: lus rgyu yin na ni /
translated: If the body were the cause of the mind,

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i lus nyid gzhan gyi tshe rgyu ma yin no zhes mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i lus nyid gzhan gyi tshe rgyu ma yin no zhes mi 'thad do //
translated: then that very body, which is the cause of the mind, would not be the cause of the body at another time.

original: mi mthun pa de 'dra ba nyid kyis 'ga' zhig ni 'chi la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bas rnam par dbye ba 'dir ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi mthun pa de 'dra ba nyid kyis 'ga' zhig ni 'chi la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bas rnam par dbye ba 'dir ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how can there be a distinction in the case of death, since it is not the same for everyone?

original: sems rgyu yin na ni sems mi mthun pa med pa dang yod pas 'chig ba dang cig shos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: sems rgyu yin na ni sems mi mthun pa med pa dang yod pas 'chig ba dang cig shos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: If the mind were the cause of the body, then there would be no distinction in the case of death, since the mind, whether it is similar or dissimilar, is the cause of the body.

original: nyes pa nye bar zhi gyur kyang //
analyzed: nyes pa nye bar zhi gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the fault is removed,üîΩdeath is not removed by that,

original: 'chi dang 'ga' zhig nyes pa yis //üîΩnyes can yin yang 'tsho 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: 'chi dang 'ga' zhig nyes pa yis // nyes can yin yang 'tsho 'gyur ba'i //
translated: because of the fault of some.

original: rnam gnas 'dir ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam gnas 'dir ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not the case for one who lives with a fault.

original: 'bras bu ci dga' 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci dga' 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The result does not occur as one wishes.

original: des na rnam par shes pa lus kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa lus kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not the result of the body.

original: lus kyi 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: lus kyi 'bras bu yin na /
translated: If it were the result of the body,

original: slar 'tsho bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar 'tsho bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that one would live again.

original: gal te mi mthun par byed pa log kyang des byas pa'i rjes su mi mthun pa gdon mi za bar mi ldog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun par byed pa log kyang des byas pa'i rjes su mi mthun pa gdon mi za bar mi ldog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if the cause of the change is removed, is it not certain that the change produced by it will not be removed?

original: me log kyang shing la mes byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang du yang ldog par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: me log kyang shing la mes byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang du yang ldog par ma mthong ngo //
translated: Even if the fire is removed, the change produced by the fire in the wood is not seen to be removed anywhere.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / gal te me ni log na yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te me ni log na yang //
translated: Even if the fire is removed,

original: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog bzhin //
analyzed: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog bzhin //
translated: the change in the wood is not removed.

original: de ni ldog pa med ce na //
analyzed: de ni ldog pa med ce na //
translated: If you say that the change in the body is not removed,

original: ma yin gso sbyong yod phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin gso sbyong yod phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because healing is possible.

original: dper na me log kyang shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog pa de bzhin du nyes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba 'chi @66b ba yang mi ldog pa des na slar 'tsho bar thal ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dper na me log kyang shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog pa de bzhin du nyes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba 'chi @66b ba yang mi ldog pa des na slar 'tsho bar thal ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Just as even if the fire is removed, the change in the wood is not removed, so too, even if the change produced by the fault, death, is not removed, it does not follow that one will live again.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ma yin te gso ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gso ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because healing is possible.

original: gal te nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu med pa yin na gso ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu med pa yin na gso ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the change produced by the fault is not removable, then it would not be possible to apply a remedy.

original: nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu yod pa yin na /
analyzed: nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu yod pa yin na /
translated: If the change of a fault can be reversed,

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir gso ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir gso ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the treatment would have an effect.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba las sngar nyes pa byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba chung du ni bzlog par bya ba yin gyi 'chi ba ni bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba las sngar nyes pa byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba chung du ni bzlog par bya ba yin gyi 'chi ba ni bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the change of a fault that has already occurred can be reversed before the change of death, then death would not be irreversible.

original: des na nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu yod pa dang med pa yin pas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na nyes pa'i 'gyur ba bzlog tu yod pa dang med pa yin pas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the change of a fault can and cannot be reversed, this fault does not exist.

original: 'di ni len ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni len ma yin te /
translated: This is not a good response.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / slar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / slar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig ni //
translated: Some changes do not recur,

original: la lar 'gyur ba skyed par byed //
analyzed: la lar 'gyur ba skyed par byed //
translated: but some changes do recur.

original: 'ga' zhig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
translated: Because some can be reversed,

original: shing dang gser la me bzhin no //üîΩdang po chung yang ldog pa min //
analyzed: shing dang gser la me bzhin no // dang po chung yang ldog pa min //
translated: like fire in wood and gold in an alloy.üîΩSome changes do not recur,

original: slar ldog rung bar 'gyur byas gang //
analyzed: slar ldog rung bar 'gyur byas gang //
translated: even though they are small at first.üîΩThat which can be reversed

original: de ni slar yang 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni slar yang 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: will occur again,

original: gser gyi sgra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sgra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the state of gold in an alloy.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te 'ga' zhig la la mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'byung ba rtsom par byed pa nyid de dper na shing la me bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te 'ga' zhig la la mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'byung ba rtsom par byed pa nyid de dper na shing la me bzhin no //
translated: For example, fire is the agent of the transformation of wood, but not of gold.

original: 'ga' zhig bzlog pas te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bzlog pas te /
translated: One thing does not transform into another thing.

original: dper na gser la de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser la de nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, gold does not transform into silver.

original: gcig nyid gcig nyid la ni //
analyzed: gcig nyid gcig nyid la ni //
translated: Nor does one thing transform into itself.üîΩFor example, fire does not transform wood into just wood.

original: de lta bu dang de lta bu ma yin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dang de lta bu ma yin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it transform what is already transformed.üîΩFor example, fire does not transform wood that has already been burned into ashes.

original: de la rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa'am /
translated: Nor does it transform what is not to be transformed.üîΩFor example, fire does not transform water into anything else.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba bya ba dang po rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni chung yang ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba bya ba dang po rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni chung yang ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it transform what is being transformed.

original: mes ni shing la nag po tsam byas pa yang ldog pa ma yin la /üîΩgser shin tu zhu yang me log na'ang gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mes ni shing la nag po tsam byas pa yang ldog pa ma yin la /üîΩgser shin tu zhu yang me log na'ang gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: For example, fire does not transform wood that is in the process of being burned into something else.

original: des na nyes par byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba chung ngu na log pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid chen po yang ldog par 'gyur ba des na slar 'tsho bar thal lo //
analyzed: des na nyes par byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba chung ngu na log pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid chen po yang ldog par 'gyur ba des na slar 'tsho bar thal lo //
translated: Therefore, if the small transformation of the body due to a fault is reversed, then even the great characteristic of death would be reversed. Therefore, it follows that one would live again.

original: 'di ltar gnyid kyis sems pa dang 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba byas kyang gnyid med na ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid kyis sems pa dang 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba byas kyang gnyid med na ldog pa yin no //
translated: In this way, even though a transformation of the body is made due to the characteristic of being separated from sleep, if one is not asleep, it is reversed.

original: 'on te de ldog pa med do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te de ldog pa med do zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that it is not reversed,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the absence of awareness.

original: rig par 'dod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rig par 'dod pa ma yin te //
translated: It is not asserted to be awareness.

original: 'di ltar gal te de yod na //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de yod na //
translated: In this way, if it exists,

original: shi la'ang rig pa yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: shi la'ang rig pa yod par 'gyur //
translated: then awareness would exist even in the dead.

original: shi dang gnyid @67a * //üîΩlog pa dag lam //
analyzed: shi dang gnyid @67a * // log pa dag lam //
translated: In death and sleep,

original: rig pa med par khyad par med //
analyzed: rig pa med par khyad par med //
translated: there is no difference in the absence of awareness.

original: dbugs rngub la sogs thams cad ni //
analyzed: dbugs rngub la sogs thams cad ni //
translated: All inhalation and so on

original: ci ltar de yang bsam pa yis //
analyzed: ci ltar de yang bsam pa yis //
translated: are also to be considered in the same way.

original: shi ba dang gnyid log pa dag la ni rig pa med pa nyid las khyad par gzhan med do //
analyzed: shi ba dang gnyid log pa dag la ni rig pa med pa nyid las khyad par gzhan med do //
translated: In death and sleep, there is no difference in the absence of awareness.

original: des na gnyid log pa sad par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: des na gnyid log pa sad par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as one who is asleep awakens,

original: shi ba yang bsnun pa dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas 'tsho bar thal lo //
analyzed: shi ba yang bsnun pa dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas 'tsho bar thal lo //
translated: it follows that one who is dead would live again through the application of massage, medicine, and so on.

original: 'on te gnyid log pa la ni rig pa med pa nyid la /
analyzed: 'on te gnyid log pa la ni rig pa med pa nyid la /
translated: But if you say that in the case of sleep there is no awareness,

original: shi ba la ni de yod pas khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shi ba la ni de yod pas khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: whereas in the case of death there is, and that is the difference,

original: ma yin te rig pa med par ni gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rig pa med par ni gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because both are similar in the absence of awareness.

original: 'on te rig pa med kyang de nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa med kyang de nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that even though there is no awareness, it exists as a potential,

original: nus pa zhes pa snyad pa de ci zhig / gal te nus pa myong ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rig pa nyid yod pas ji ltar rig pa med pa yin te yod pa yang yin med pa yang yin no zhes 'gal lo //
analyzed: nus pa zhes pa snyad pa de ci zhig / gal te nus pa myong ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rig pa nyid yod pas ji ltar rig pa med pa yin te yod pa yang yin med pa yang yin no zhes 'gal lo //
translated: what is this so-called potential? If the potential is just the experience, then at that time awareness itself exists, so how can there be no awareness? It is contradictory to say that it both exists and does not exist.

original: 'on te nus pa rig pa las gzhan yin no//
analyzed: 'on te nus pa rig pa las gzhan yin no//
translated: But if the potential is different from awareness,

original: 'on te lus nyid yin pa des na sems skyed par byed pa'i lus gnas pa na nus pa yod pa'i phyir de mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te lus nyid yin pa des na sems skyed par byed pa'i lus gnas pa na nus pa yod pa'i phyir de mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: then if the body itself is the potential, since the body that produces the mind exists as long as it abides, the potential would not cease.

original: 'on te skyed par byed pa'i lus ni zhig la //
analyzed: 'on te skyed par byed pa'i lus ni zhig la //
translated: But if the body that produces is destroyed,

original: gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa skyes pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa skyes pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and another body that does not produce is born, then there is no consciousness.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de gang yin /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de gang yin /
translated: What is the body that does not produce?

original: rig pa dang bral ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa dang bral ba'o zhe na /
translated: It is the body devoid of consciousness.

original: gnyid log pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir gnyid log pa las kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs su rig pa yod pa'i phyir de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid log pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir gnyid log pa las kyang sad pa'i gnas skabs su rig pa yod pa'i phyir de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is also present in one who is asleep. Therefore, consciousness would also exist in the state of awakening, since it exists in sleep.

original: gal te de la dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te de la dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa yod na /
translated: If there is inhalation and exhalation in that state,

original: des na lus skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na lus skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the body is not devoid of consciousness.

original: 'o na gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i phyir gnyid log pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i phyir gnyid log pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is devoid of consciousness, then it would not be sleep, since it is born at the time of sleep.

original: 'on te gnyid yongs su gyur pa dang lhan cig pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dag las sems pa skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyid yongs su gyur pa dang lhan cig pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dag las sems pa skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if consciousness arises from the inhalation and exhalation that accompany the transformation of sleep,

original: gnyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhig //
analyzed: gnyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhig //
translated: what is this thing called sleep?

original: rig pa med ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa med ba'o zhe na /
translated: It is the absence of consciousness.

original: shi ba la yang de yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shi ba la yang de yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it exists even when dead.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba na slar rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba na slar rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a complete transformation, it will be known again.

original: gal te dbugs rngub pa med pas lhan cig bye pa ma tshang ba'i phyir lus 'ba' zhig las mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbugs rngub pa med pas lhan cig bye pa ma tshang ba'i phyir lus 'ba' zhig las mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not arise from the body alone because the simultaneous condition of inhalation is incomplete,

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba la yang dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba la yang dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because there is no inhalation, etc. in the transformation of fainting, etc.,

original: rig @67b pa yod par min 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig @67b pa yod par min 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness would not exist.

original: de'i phyir dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni rig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni rig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, inhalation, etc. are not the cause of consciousness.

original: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that inhalation, etc. are not the cause.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gnyid dang bral bar 'gyur na blo //üîΩshes pa snga ma'i 'du byed las //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gnyid dang bral bar 'gyur na blo // shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed las //
translated: When free from sleep, the mindüîΩArises from the formative forces of previous consciousness.

original: de lta'i rnam par 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de lta'i rnam par 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: It arises in that way.

original: de yi phyir na lus rgyu min //
analyzed: de yi phyir na lus rgyu min //
translated: Therefore, the body is not its cause.

original: lung mtshungs par yod pa yin yang blo la sogs pa ni sngon gyi 'du byed dang rjes su mthong pa nyid du mthong ngo //üîΩdes na lus sam dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: lung mtshungs par yod pa yin yang blo la sogs pa ni sngon gyi 'du byed dang rjes su mthong pa nyid du mthong ngo // des na lus sam dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Although the scriptural citation is the same, the mind and so on are seen to be the prior formative forces.

original: rgyu ma yin no //üîΩ'on te 'du byed lhan cig pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin no // 'on te 'du byed lhan cig pa'i //
translated: Therefore, the body or inhalation and so on are not the cause.

original: lus las skye ba brjod ce na /
analyzed: lus las skye ba brjod ce na /
translated: If you say that the body arises from the formative forces that are simultaneous with it,

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'du byed de tshe med pa ni //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'du byed de tshe med pa ni //
translated: that is not so,

original: lhan cig byed 'gyur phyir 'thad dka' //
analyzed: lhan cig byed 'gyur phyir 'thad dka' //
translated: because it is difficult to accept that the formative forces that are simultaneous with the bodyüîΩare the cause of the body that is without formative forces.

original: med pa ni yod pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin no //üîΩsems med pa las /
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin no // sems med pa las /
translated: That which does not exist cannot be a simultaneous cause of that which exists.üîΩIf you say that the body arises from the mind that is simultaneous with it, that is not so,

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na lus bzhin du sngon gyi sems kyang yod pa ni ma yin pa nyid do ;
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na lus bzhin du sngon gyi sems kyang yod pa ni ma yin pa nyid do ;
translated: because the body is not the cause of the mind that is simultaneous with it.

original: / med pa ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin te /üîΩlhan cig tu bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / med pa ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin te / lhan cig tu bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not exist cannot be a simultaneous cause of that which exists.

original: yod pa dang med pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: That which exists and that which does not exist do not occur simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir de la sems snga ma nyid rgyu yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la sems snga ma nyid rgyu yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the prior mind is the cause of the subsequent mind, but the body is not.

original: 'o na ji ltar bsnun pa la sogs pa sad par byed pa yin zhe na /üîΩde ni lam ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bsnun pa la sogs pa sad par byed pa yin zhe na / de ni lam ma yin te /
translated: But how can striking and so on awaken one from sleep?

original: sad pa gdon mi za bar ni //
analyzed: sad pa gdon mi za bar ni //
translated: That is not the path to awakening.üîΩUndoubtedly, awakening

original: bsnun sogs nyid las skye ba min //
analyzed: bsnun sogs nyid las skye ba min //
translated: does not arise from striking and so on.

original: rab tu brdegs pa med par yang //
analyzed: rab tu brdegs pa med par yang //
translated: Without being struck and so on,

original: sad pa dag ni dmigs pa yin //üîΩbsnun pa la sogs pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: sad pa dag ni dmigs pa yin // bsnun pa la sogs pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: awakening is observed.

original: sad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sad pa ma yin te /
translated: Awakening is not from striking and so on,

original: rang nyid kyang sad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang sad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the striker is awakened.

original: gal te sad ma thag tu mthong ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtogs pa skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sad ma thag tu mthong ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtogs pa skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the thought that is related to the object seen does not arise immediately upon awakening,

original: des na mthong ba dang sngon gyi rnam par shes pa dag ni ci ltar lhan cig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na mthong ba dang sngon gyi rnam par shes pa dag ni ci ltar lhan cig pa yin zhe na /
translated: then how can seeing and the prior consciousness be simultaneous?

original: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not good.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / nye bar gnas pa sad gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nye bar gnas pa sad gyur pa //
translated: Awakening that is present

original: 'di la'ang nges pa yod min te ;üîΩ/ der gtad pa yis gang 'phangs nas //üîΩgnyid log de las sad phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la'ang nges pa yod min te ; / der gtad pa yis gang 'phangs nas // gnyid log de las sad phyir ro //
translated: is also not certain.üîΩFrom what is it projectedüîΩso that one awakens from sleep?

original: gang zhig lhur gtad pas 'phangs nas //
analyzed: gang zhig lhur gtad pas 'phangs nas //
translated: From what is it projected

original: gnyid log pa de dang mthun pa nyid du 'di'i bag chags sad par 'gyur ba yin gyi sad pa na /üîΩgang zhig dmigs pa de dang 'brel bar nye bar nyid @68a * //üîΩrtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyid log pa de dang mthun pa nyid du 'di'i bag chags sad par 'gyur ba yin gyi sad pa na / gang zhig dmigs pa de dang 'brel bar nye bar nyid @68a * // rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The latent impressions of that dream are awakened in conformity with the sleep.üîΩBut when one is awake, the object is not perceived in the way it was imagined in the dream.

original: gang cig ltar goms pa dang de de lta bur 'gyur ba nyid rtogs par mthong ba yin no //üîΩsad pa ni gang gi reg pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gang cig ltar goms pa dang de de lta bur 'gyur ba nyid rtogs par mthong ba yin no // sad pa ni gang gi reg pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: One sees that the object is not as it was imagined.üîΩWhen one is awake, the nature of the body is tactile sensations.

original: gang zhig ci ltar goms pa de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du lus kyi reg bya rig pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ci ltar goms pa de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du lus kyi reg bya rig pa yin no //
translated: One experiences tactile sensations in conformity with what one is accustomed to.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / 'jigs dang brtan sogs 'du byed las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jigs dang brtan sogs 'du byed las //
translated: from the formative forces of fear, courage, etc.,

original: 'bras dang mtshon 'dzin la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'bras dang mtshon 'dzin la sogs pa //
translated: the results of the apprehension of a snake, a rope, etc.,

original: bde sogs rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: bde sogs rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: the natures of the realizations of pleasure, etc.,

original: srog chags rnams la skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la skye bar 'gyur //
translated: arise in living beings.

original: 'jigs pa goms pa'i khyim du zhugs pa rnams la ni sad pa ni bros pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa nyid de gzhan du sdug bsngal bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa goms pa'i khyim du zhugs pa rnams la ni sad pa ni bros pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa nyid de gzhan du sdug bsngal bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are accustomed to fear, when they enter a haunted house, know that it is easy to escape and so on, and they remain there without suffering.

original: gzhan la 'tshe bar mngon par dga' ba drag po'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu mtshon la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bde ba la sogs par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'tshe bar mngon par dga' ba drag po'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu mtshon la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bde ba la sogs par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Those whose nature is to delight in harming others, when they take up weapons and so on, the cause of harming others, know that it is pleasant and so on, by their very nature.

original: des na lus sam dbugs rngub pa la sogs par ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na lus sam dbugs rngub pa la sogs par ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body or inhalation and so on are not the cause of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It is only a previous consciousness that is the cause.

original: de yang gal te lus las skyes pa yin na ni de'i tshe ldog pa med par thal lo zhes bya ba'i skyon de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang gal te lus las skyes pa yin na ni de'i tshe ldog pa med par thal lo zhes bya ba'i skyon de nyid yin no //
translated: And if that arises from the body, then the fault stated earlier would apply: it would follow that it is not terminated.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba can du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, it would not be continuous with a previous consciousness.

original: 'on te nyes pas mi mthun par byas pa'i rgyu ma yin na ni mi mthun pa med na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te nyes pas mi mthun par byas pa'i rgyu ma yin na ni mi mthun pa med na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not the cause of the transformation that is incompatible with the fault, then the transformation would occur even when there is no incompatibility.

original: phyir mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos rtsom par byed pa nyid yin na ni nyam chung ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa zhan par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dam brgyal ba la sogs pa rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid des byas pa'i rnam par 'gyurüîΩba chung du yang bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //üîΩphyir log pa med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rtsom par byed pa ni chung ngu yang bzlog tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos rtsom par byed pa nyid yin na ni nyam chung ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa zhan par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dam brgyal ba la sogs pa rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid des byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba chung du yang bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro // phyir log pa med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rtsom par byed pa ni chung ngu yang bzlog tu med pa yin no //
translated: If the transformation is the cause of the transformation that is incompatible with the fault, then even a slight transformation, such as a slight weakness in consciousness, or a slight interruption, such as fainting, would be irresistible.üîΩIf the transformation is the cause of the transformation that is not incompatible with the fault, then even a slight transformation would be irresistible.

original: phyir ldog pa rung bar byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa rung bar byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The transformation that is compatible with reversal can occur again,

original: gser gyi sgra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sgra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: just like the fluidity of gold.

original: gser gyi sra ba nyid ni song yang 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba ni slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sra ba nyid ni song yang 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba ni slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: The hardness of gold is not a cause for its returning, since it is free from the cause of change.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes la rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba chen po @68b yang bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes la rnam par chad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba chen po @68b yang bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, consciousness, which has the characteristic of being interrupted, is also subject to a great change, but it is to be reversed.

original: slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it returns to life.

original: gal te gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir slar ldog par rung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir slar ldog par rung ba nyid yin la /
translated: If it is suitable for it to return because there is a method of healing,

original: bsgrub tu med pa'i nad kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ni slar ldog par byar med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang yod pas na skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub tu med pa'i nad kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ni slar ldog par byar med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang yod pas na skyon med do zhe na /
translated: and if it is not suitable for it to return because it is a state of incurable illness, then since both are possible, there is no fault.

original: lan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: lan bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: cung zad gso bya min brjod pa //
analyzed: cung zad gso bya min brjod pa //
translated: It is said that it is not slightly curable

original: 'chos byed rnyed par dka' phyir ram //
analyzed: 'chos byed rnyed par dka' phyir ram //
translated: because the method of healing is difficult to find.

original: tshe zad phyir ro nyes 'ba' zhig / gso na gso min med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyid ni nyes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba sel nus pa dang sman dang sman pa rnyed par dka' ba las 'thad pa las yin la /
analyzed: tshe zad phyir ro nyes 'ba' zhig / gso na gso min med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyid ni nyes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba sel nus pa dang sman dang sman pa rnyed par dka' ba las 'thad pa las yin la /
translated: Because life is exhausted, there is only fault. If it can be cured, it is not incurable. The reason is that it is possible to remove the transformation caused by fault, and it is possible to find medicine and a doctor.

original: sems 'byung ba chen po las 'gyur bar smra ba'i gzhung las bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'byung ba chen po las 'gyur bar smra ba'i gzhung las bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas, who maintain that the great elements are transformed, there is nothing that is incurable.

original: 'o na 'chos par byed pa rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir slar 'tsho ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'chos par byed pa rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir slar 'tsho ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is difficult to find a doctor, then it is not possible to be cured.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni med de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: de ni med de gang gi phyir //
translated: Because

original: rnam 'gyur ldog pa min na ni //
analyzed: rnam 'gyur ldog pa min na ni //
translated: If the transformation does not cease,

original: 'chos byed rnyed par dka' ba nyid //
analyzed: 'chos byed rnyed par dka' ba nyid //
translated: then it is difficult to find a doctor.

original: slar 'tsho ba yi rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: slar 'tsho ba yi rgyu ma yin //
translated: That is not the cause of being cured.

original: ldog na don med 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ldog na don med 'gyur ba yin //
translated: If it does cease, it is meaningless.

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba log na slar 'tsho bar thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba log na slar 'tsho bar thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if the transformation ceases, it follows that one is cured.

original: gal te gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na ;
translated: If you say that something that is not to be cured exists,

original: 'di la lan nga la ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di la lan nga la ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid 'thad do //
translated: then we reply that it is not tenable that something is not to be cured.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: tshe zad pa'i phyir na nad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe zad pa'i phyir na nad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because life is exhausted, a disease is not to be cured.

original: 'di ltar na de lta bu nyid kyis 'ga' zhig 'tsho ba dang gzhan ni ma yin par mthong ngo /
analyzed: 'di ltar na de lta bu nyid kyis 'ga' zhig 'tsho ba dang gzhan ni ma yin par mthong ngo /
translated: Thus, in this way, it is seen that some live and others do not.

original: tshe ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: tshe ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: Life is an illustration,

original: las zad pa las kyang yin no //
analyzed: las zad pa las kyang yin no //
translated: but it is also due to the exhaustion of karma.

original: sha bkra ba la sogs pa las skyes ba'i nad ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sha bkra ba la sogs pa las skyes ba'i nad ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: A disease that arises from the exhaustion of karma is not to be cured,

original: las de 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that kind of karma exists.

original: de'i phyir las bdag bor 'gyur ba nyid lan gyi rgyur smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las bdag bor 'gyur ba nyid lan gyi rgyur smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we say that karma is the cause of the reply.

original: nyes pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: nyes pa 'ba' zhig rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is only a fault that is to be cured,

original: gso bar bya ba ma yin pa'i nad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gso bar bya ba ma yin pa'i nad med pa nyid do //
translated: then a disease that is not to be cured does not exist.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir // shi ba'i dus sogs log phyir ram //
analyzed: de'i phyir // shi ba'i dus sogs log phyir ram //
translated: because the time of death and so on is reversed,

original: de yi sos zin bcad las kyang //
analyzed: de yi sos zin bcad las kyang //
translated: And when it is healed, it is cut again.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba na //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral ba na //
translated: When it is free from the cause of change,

original: de cis slar yang 'tsho mi 'gyur //üîΩshi ba la gang tshe sngags la sogs pas dug la sogs pas ldog par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de cis slar yang 'tsho mi 'gyur // shi ba la gang tshe sngags la sogs pas dug la sogs pas ldog par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: why would it not live again?üîΩWhen one dies, it is possible that one is revived by a mantra, poison, or the like.

original: de'i sos zin pa bcad @69a * //üîΩpa las te /
analyzed: de'i sos zin pa bcad @69a * // pa las te /
translated: Or, when it is healed, it is cut again.üîΩWhen it is healed, it is cut again by itself.

original: sos zin pa rang nyid 'dus pa bcad pas log pa dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu rims la sogs pa dang / bral ba gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: sos zin pa rang nyid 'dus pa bcad pas log pa dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu rims la sogs pa dang / bral ba gang gi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: When it is free from the cause of change, such as a fever, then it changes. At that time, it lives again.

original: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ldog pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ldog pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not because the cause of appropriation ceases.

original: lus kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the cause of appropriation.

original: gal te yin na de rnam par ma gyur par rnam par mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yin na de rnam par ma gyur par rnam par mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, it would follow that it would not change without changing.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩnyer len 'gyur ba med pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / nyer len 'gyur ba med pa ni //
translated: BecauseüîΩThe appropriated does not change.

original: nyer len can dag 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: nyer len can dag 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The appropriator changes.

original: byed par mi nus dper 'jim pa //
analyzed: byed par mi nus dper 'jim pa //
translated: It cannot be made to change, like clay.

original: 'gyur pa med par bum sogs bzhin //
analyzed: 'gyur pa med par bum sogs bzhin //
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: nye bar len pa lus 'gyur ba med par nye bar len pa las byung ba rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byar mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa lus 'gyur ba med par nye bar len pa las byung ba rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byar mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: It is impossible for consciousness to change without the appropriating body changing.

original: 'jim pa 'gyur ba med par bum pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba ni ma dmigs so //
analyzed: 'jim pa 'gyur ba med par bum pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba ni ma dmigs so //
translated: A pot, etc. is not observed to change without clay, etc. changing.

original: nye bar len pa'i chos kyang 'di nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i chos kyang 'di nyid de /
translated: The appropriating body is the appropriated.

original: de 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It changes because it changes.

original: rgyu mang po yod kyang ni 'ga' zhig gi nye bar len par yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mang po yod kyang ni 'ga' zhig gi nye bar len par yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though there are many causes, some are appropriated, but causes in general are not.

original: lus ni rgyu nyid yin yang de 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus ni rgyu nyid yin yang de 'gyur ba nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The body is a cause, but it does not change because it changes.üîΩEven though it does not change, the mind changes because of grief, sorrow, and so on.

original: de ma 'gyur yang 'jig pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas snga ma'i sems rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma 'gyur yang 'jig pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas snga ma'i sems rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it changes, it does not necessarily change.

original: gal te chu 'gyur na myu gu 'gyur ba yin yang de de'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chu 'gyur na myu gu 'gyur ba yin yang de de'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sprout would change if the water changed, but the water is not the substantial cause of the sprout,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: rgyun gyi rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyur yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyur yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the substantial cause is the cause of the continuum.

original: rgyun gyi rgyu yang sa bon yin gyi chu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyu yang sa bon yin gyi chu ni ma yin te /
translated: The seed is the cause of the continuum, but the water is not,

original: chu ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the water is the cause of the special state.

original: chu las rgyun na 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chu las rgyun na 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The continuum does not arise from the water,

original: chu ni nas la sogs pa la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu ni nas la sogs pa la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the water is common to the barley, etc.

original: chu ldog kyang s'a lu'i rgyun ldog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chu ldog kyang s'a lu'i rgyun ldog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the continuum of the rice does not cease when the water ceases,

original: chu med kyang s'a lu'i rgyun mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu med kyang s'a lu'i rgyun mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum of the rice does not cease even when there is no water.

original: myu gyu la sogs pa'i de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni chu yin pas de ni de la log na ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: myu gyu la sogs pa'i de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni chu yin pas de ni de la log na ldog pa yin no //
translated: The water is the special state of the sprout, etc., so when that ceases, it ceases.

original: des na chu de ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: des na chu de ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the water is the substantial cause.

original: chu la sogs pa las ni s'a lu'i sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nyid nas myu gu la sogs pa gong nas gong du rnam par 'gyur @69b ba yin no //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa las ni s'a lu'i sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nyid nas myu gu la sogs pa gong nas gong du rnam par 'gyur @69b ba yin no //
translated: From water, etc., the sprout, etc., are produced by the transformation of the rice seed.

original: de'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yang rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir lus 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yang rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir lus 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the transformation of the body without transformation, this body is not the material cause of consciousness.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni /üîΩdngos gang 'gyur ba med par ni //üîΩdngos po gang zhig rnam 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni / dngos gang 'gyur ba med par ni // dngos po gang zhig rnam 'gyur ba //
translated: This is explained:üîΩ‚ÄúThat which is not transformed

original: de yi nyer len mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yi nyer len mi rigs te /
translated: is not the material cause of that which is transformed.

original: ba lang ba men la sogs bzhi //

original: de yang bden min ri mo la //

translated: That is not so, because a painting, etc.,

original: sogs pas 'pho bar dmigs min pa //

analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa ltar rten gzhan nas 'ongs so zhes rtog pa med do //

original: rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i skye ba dang rab tu sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skye ba gzhan gyis lus dang lhan cig spyod pa'i 'du byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i skye ba dang rab tu sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skye ba gzhan gyis lus dang lhan cig spyod pa'i 'du byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'am /
translated: The consciousnesses are not like paintings, etc., which are not definitely restricted to a particular support, because the consciousnesses are connected with the formative forces that coexist with the body in the state of the first arising and the state of arousal by another consciousness.

original: rmi lam gyi lus kyi 'du byed dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩri mo bzhin du rten so sor nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus kyi 'du byed dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir / ri mo bzhin du rten so sor nges pa ma yin no //

original: rten so sor nges pa yin na ni rten de zhig na 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: rten so sor nges pa yin na ni rten de zhig na 'jig pa yin no //
translated: If they were definitely restricted to a particular support, they would be destroyed when that support is destroyed.

original: gzhan yang rten nyid ni lus sam gzhan 'ga' la yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid pas ji ltar de zhig na 'jig / ri mo la @71b sogs pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten nyid ni lus sam gzhan 'ga' la yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid pas ji ltar de zhig na 'jig / ri mo la @71b sogs pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid de /

original: des na rang zhig pa nyid kyis zhig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na rang zhig pa nyid kyis zhig pa yin gyi /

original: rten zhig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten zhig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin mod /
translated: If it is not the case that the basis and what is based on it are different,

original: lus dang sems tha dad pa dag ni yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: lus dang sems tha dad pa dag ni yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: then the body and mind are different.

original: 'di ni med de /
analyzed: 'di ni med de /

original: yod med dag la rten med phyir //üîΩma yin yod pa'i gnas rgyu ni //
analyzed: yod med dag la rten med phyir // ma yin yod pa'i gnas rgyu ni //
translated: Because what exists and does not exist have no basis.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the existence of what exists

analyzed: rten yin zhe na 'di rten med //

original: gnas pa po las gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: gnas pa po las gzhan min phyir //

original: 'di ni rten yod ma yin mod //
analyzed: 'di ni rten yod ma yin mod //

original: gzhan yin na yang de rgyu nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yin na yang de rgyu nyid //

original: des ni dngos po ci zhig byas //
analyzed: des ni dngos po ci zhig byas //

original: re zhig med pa la ni rten yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig med pa la ni rten yod pa ma yin te /

original: ri bong gi rva la ni rten 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la ni rten 'ga' yang med do //

original: med pa ni rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de des na med pa ni rgyu nyid srid kyi rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de des na med pa ni rgyu nyid srid kyi rten ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only maintained that the nonexistent is produced from a cause, but not that it is supported.

original: yod pa la yang rten yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la yang rten yod pa ma yin te /

original: yod pa ni ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

original: yod pa yang gnas par byed pa'i phyir rten yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang gnas par byed pa'i phyir rten yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te /

analyzed: gnas pa ni gnas pa po las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gnas par byed na de nyid byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: skyes pa yang skyed par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te skyes pa la yang ma skyes pa cung zad yod pas na de byed pa'i phyir rten yin no //

analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad skyed pa ni rgyu yin par brjod la /

original: chos 'ga' zhig bskyed pa ni rten la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig bskyed pa ni rten la sogs pa yin no //

original: gnas pa ni rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ma yin te /

original: lhung ba gnas pa med pa la yang rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung ba gnas pa med pa la yang rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te gnas tha dad pa med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnas tha dad pa med pa yin na ni /

original: de gnas pa las tha dad pa med par 'gyur bas thams cad kyi tshe gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnas pa las tha dad pa med par 'gyur bas thams cad kyi tshe gnas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod pa na ldog pa ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes rigs so zhe na /

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

original: gzhan yin na ni 'di de'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yin na ni 'di de'i rgyu nyid de /

analyzed: 'di gnas pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi rten ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is the cause of stability, but not the support.

original: dngos po'i rten yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rten yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the support of the entity,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dngos po la ni ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la ni ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: dngos po'i gnas pa byed pa'i phyir rten yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas pa byed pa'i phyir rten yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the support because it causes the stability of the entity,

original: ci gnas pa ni skyes pa na gnas par bya ba @72a * //
analyzed: ci gnas pa ni skyes pa na gnas par bya ba @72a * //
translated: What is enduring? It is that which endures when arisen.üîΩ

original: yin nam 'on te gzhan du yin te /
analyzed: yin nam 'on te gzhan du yin te /

original: de ni skyes pa'i sngon du ni dngos po ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes pa'i sngon du ni dngos po ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: tha dad pa gzhan las skyes pa ji ltar dngos po'i yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan las skyes pa ji ltar dngos po'i yin te /

analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between it and that which is different from it, either by identity or origination.

original: de dang 'dus par skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: de dang 'dus par skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;

analyzed: de dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin / der gnas pa'o zhe na /
translated: what is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúin conjunction with that‚Äù?üîΩIf you say that it is ‚Äúin conjunction with that‚Äù because it endures in that,

analyzed: gnas pa la yang gnas pa gzhan yod pas thug pa med do //
translated: then since that which endures also endures in something else, there is an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yin na tha dad pa nyid du ci ste mi rtogs /
analyzed: gzhan yin na tha dad pa nyid du ci ste mi rtogs /

original: 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is connected by the conjunction of contact,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba yod mod /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba yod mod /

analyzed: de lta na yang gang gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de de nyid du ji ste mi rtogs te /
translated: but why is it not considered to be that which is of the nature of that which is in contact?

original: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs /
translated: Why is it considered to be something else?

original: 'byar ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'byar ba'i phyir ro zhe na /

analyzed: 'byar ba zhes bya ba de ci yin /

analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar na ni tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are joined by their entire self-existence, they would not be different.

analyzed: so so ba dang so so ba ma yin par grub pa'o zhe na /

analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyang 'phrod pa 'du bar thal lo //

original: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are the basis of the idea ‚Äúthis is that,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ldan pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ldan pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: It follows that they are joined,

original: mgo la rva'o zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mgo la rva'o zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro ;

analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad par rtog pas 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin no //
translated: even so, because they are conceived as different, they are not combined.

analyzed: yan lag med pa'i dngos po ni yan lag dang 'byar ba ma yin no //

analyzed: yan lag dang 'byar ba na ni tha dad par rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rjes su zhugs pas tha dad do zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin te /

original: mngon sum gyis rjes su 'gro ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rjes su 'gro ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mngon sum med pa ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med do //

analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i khyad par nyid rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no //

analyzed: lus ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pas de log na ldog pa ma @72b yin no //

original: gal te gnas par byed pa'i phyir lus rten yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnas par byed pa'i phyir lus rten yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe gang la gnas pa'i yod pa de mi 'jig pa'i phyir /

original: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur //

original: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //

analyzed: de la thal ba mtshungs pa yin //

analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya //

original: gnas par byed pa yod pa la 'jig pa mi srid do //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yod pa la 'jig pa mi srid do //

analyzed: 'on te yang gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu med na gnas par byed pa yod pa na 'jig pa ma yin pa zhig na /
translated: But if you say that if there is no cause of cessation, then that which endures does not cease while the cause of endurance exists,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yod pa las zhig pa'i phyir 'jig pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yod pa las zhig pa'i phyir 'jig pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: and that therefore the error of the nonexistence of cessation does not arise because it ceases due to the existence of a cause of cessation,

original: gal te de 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then if you say that it ceases due to a cause of cessation,

original: ma yin te /üîΩde la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: ma yin te / de la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa yin //
translated: that is not so.üîΩThe same reductio would apply.

original: 'jig pa de yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa de yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs so //

analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba dngos po las gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //

original: gzhan yin na de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin na de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: If it is different, it is the cause of that.

original: de dngos po ci zhig byas /
analyzed: de dngos po ci zhig byas /
translated: What thing does it make?

analyzed: 'jig pa gzhan byas na de 'jig ces bya ba ni ma yin no //

original: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cause of destruction does not make anything.

analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'jig pas bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: Since it does not cease, it endures by itself. What does the cause of endurance do?

analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ni cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause of endurance does not make anything.

original: yang na gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if destruction is due to the cause of destruction,

analyzed: ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pa de srid rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /

original: gal te 'jig rgyu phrad bar du //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rgyu phrad bar du //

original: des gnas 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //
analyzed: des gnas 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //

original: yod la 'di gnod med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod la 'di gnod med pa'i phyir //

original: gnas pa'i rgyus ni ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus ni ci zhig bya //
